According to what Bethesda said about this DLC, you will have to have a rig that over exceeds the recommend requirements for the game.  Otherwise, it will not work.  From what I've seen on pictures, it seems that some people only get a bit of the change while a few get the full effect.  I'm mainly seeing people with armor changes and some with landscape changes, so I think it will depend on your rig.  I don't fully know how this DLC will work though.

well i haven't noticed anything different from first glance, maybe i will notice things later. But this won't break your game , not sure if it actually works or not. but I am gonna seed for a while. Enjoy !

Thank you for the torrent but I really have to criticize the installer.  I am assuming you used NSIS.

Next time you should use:
InstallDirRegKey HKLM "SOFTWAREBethesda SoftworksSkyrim" "Installed Path"
instead of:
InstallDir "C:Program FilesBethesda SoftworksThe Elder Scrolls V Skyrim"

and include in the Section/SectionEnd the command:

WriteINIStr "$DOCUMENTSMy GamesSkyrimSkyrimPrefs.ini" Launcher bEnableFileSelection 1

so that it doesn't need to be done manually.

Just a little heads up for next time!
Sorry for the lack of slashes above, apparently they don't show.. but I think you got the message anyhow. =P
Also if I'm wrong and you didn't, then you should!

This is weird but, after installing this DLC I'm not being able to use Skyrim Script Extender (SKSE), which is required for some mods to work properly. 

When I try to run the game with SKSE enabled, it gives me an error message saying "Please update to the latest version of Skyrim". But that's not the real problem since I've already got the latest patch.

Is there a way to only install the texture pack and not the updates?  I'm asking because I'm doing a fresh install, and am downloading the Update 8 torrent as well.  The fact that this texture pack "includes all previous updates" makes me wonder if installing it last will overwrite the latest update I have already installed.  Any ideas?
